About Me

Welcome to my personal webpage. I am Sanchit Alekh.

I am currently working as a Big Data Engineer at Data Reply GmbH in Munich, where I work on a diverse range of projects, mainly in the area of cloud and distributed computing. On my most recent project, I worked as a part of a team that developed an enterprise chatbot platform on the Microsoft Azure Cloud using technologies such as Kubernetes, Terraform, Botframework and Microsoft Cognitive Services.

Combining my knowledge of software engineering, databases and distributed systems, I help customers develop and deploy complex software that routinely interacts with, and acts upon massive amounts of data on different kinds of infrastructure, i.e., on-premise or on public clouds such as AWS, Azure or GCP.

Previously, I was working as a Data Scientist Intern at AUDI AG in Neckarsulm, Germany, where our focus was on building solutions for smart-factories and enable data-driven production. I am a firm champion of using data analytics for making production more efficient, cost-effective and less wasteful.

I pursued my MSc. in Software Systems Engineering from RWTH Aachen University, Germany’s largest and leading technical university, where my coursework and research were focused in the area of ‘Data and Information Management’. I was closely associated with the chair of Databases and Information Systems, where I worked under Prof. Christoph Quix.

To know more about my personal life, please visit this page. To know about my academics, head to my Academics page.

Current Events and Notifications

  • 01.01.2021: I have successfully spent 5 years in Germany. My heartfelt gratitude and thanks to everyone who I've come to know during this period. It's been a truly enriching and life-changing experience

Past Events:

  • 01.03.2019: I joined Data Reply GmbH in Munich in the role of a Consultant Big Data Engineer.
  • 10.01.2019: In July 2018, I began begin my Master Thesis at AUDI AG, jointly supervised by Dr. Christoph Quix and Dr. Sandra Geisler at RWTH and Christoph Ring at AUDI AG. I defended it successfully in January 2019.
  • 15.01.2018: I successfully passed the DSM exam, equivalent to Level B1 in German at the Sprachenzentrum RWTH Aachen
  • 01.01.2018: In January 2018, I joined AUDI AG for an Internship as a Data Scientist.
  • 20.10.2017: I performed at the Diwali festival celebration in Aachen, organised by AISA (Association of Indian Students in Aachen)
  • 07.07.2017: I delivered a talk on Automatic Raga Recognition in Hindustani Classical Music for my seminar on Computer Music. The slides can be found here. Along with that, there is also an accompanying academic paper, which can be found here.
  • 25.04.2017: I took two seminars, namely Privacy and Big Data and Computer Music and a lab course on SMT-Solving with Simplex
  • 15.04.2017: I started my the second semester of my Master studies. In this semester, I am taking courses on Logic Programming, Software Project Management and Functional Safety and System Dependability
  • 10.03.2017: I came to the end of the first phase of my exam season. I took exams in 5 subjects, namely Satisfiability Checking, Computer Vision, Virtual Reality, Big Data in Medical Informatics and Implementation of Databases.
  • 22.11.2016: I helped as a volunteer to organize the Tag Der Informatik (Computer Science Day) at RWTH
  • 16.10.2016: I continued my role as a Research Assistant at the Databases and Information Systems Group under PD Dr. Christoph Quix
  • 05.10.2016: I delivered a talk at i5 on Machine Learning Methods. Slides are available here
